subject: Gardening
title: Fruit as a Travel Strategy
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fruit as a Travel Strategy usable.

hook.text: A strawberry doesn't exist for you to enjoy. It exists to make you carry seeds away from the parent plant.

buildup.text: Fleshy fruits bribe animals with sugar and vitamins. Seeds pass through digestive tracts and land in new territory.

discovery.text: Avocados evolved for megafaunaâ€”giant ground sloths swallowed them whole. Those animals are now extinct.

twist.text: Without megafauna, avocados should have gone extinct too. Humans accidentally took over the seed-dispersal role.

climax.text: Every fruit is a contract: sweetness in exchange for transportation. The terms were set millions of years ago.

punchline.text: You eat the fruit. The plant eats the distance.

quiz.question: Why might avocados have gone extinct without human cultivation?
options: Their thick skin prevented water absorption in changing climates
The megafauna that dispersed their large seeds went extinct
They depended on volcanic soil nutrients that became depleted
